meanings.definition: Make (a liquid) thinner or weaker by adding water or another solvent to it.
meanings.sent1: She dilutes the juice with water to make it less sweet.
meanings.sent2: The chef dilutes the sauce to adjust the flavor.
meanings.sent3: The magician dilutes the potion, but it still tastes like grape juice.
meanings.sent4: His lies dilute the truth, making it hard to distinguish.
meanings.sent5: The rain dilutes the paint, creating a watery mess on the canvas.

meanings.definition: Make (something) weaker in force, content, or value by modifying it.
meanings.sent1: The addition of irrelevant details dilutes the impact of the story.
meanings.sent2: The compromise dilutes the original purpose of the plan.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to dilute the seriousness of the situation with humor backfired.
meanings.sent4: The new policy dilutes the authority of the manager, causing confusion.
meanings.sent5: The excessive use of adjectives dilutes the clarity of the message, making it hard to understand.
